item.title: ‚Äú2020 highlighted the power of community. People provided...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

‚Äú2020 highlighted the power of community. People provided mutual aid to those in need during the COVID-19 crisis when the local and federal governments failed to do so. The protests and demonstrations for racial justice led to substantial changes (e.g., SB-217, renaming Stapleton and Columbus Park, eliminating school resources officers from DPS, etc.) that myself, friends and comrades, and elders had been pushing for decades. Black women and femmes, many who are grassroots organizers, were instrumental in mitigating voter suppression and advocating for policy changes.

‚ÄúIn sum, this was a year where, in a time of distress, grief, and tragedy, we saw the power of collective action to create the changes we want to see in our community and re-imagine new or better systems.‚Äù

‚Äî Dr. Apryl Alexander

Bye.

denverite.com

What a turbulent 2020 has taught some of Denver's leaders, influencers and inspirers

Bye.Bye.
item.author: Black Lives Matter 5280

item.title: Good morning and happy Kwanzaa, beautiful people! The sixth...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Good morning and happy Kwanzaa, beautiful people! The sixth principle of Kwanzaa is KUUMBA, which means CREATIVITY. How do you use your creative mind and talents to create a better world?

item.title: Good morning and happy Kwanzaa, beautiful people! The fifth...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Good morning and happy Kwanzaa, beautiful people! The fifth principle of Kwanzaa is NIA, which means PURPOSE. What is your purpose in the collective fight toward liberation?

item.title: ‚ÄúThis new civil rights movement ‚Äì these kids are bold, and I...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

‚ÄúThis new civil rights movement ‚Äì these kids are bold, and I have to be just as bold," Rigmaiden said. "You know, I‚Äôm 71 now and I‚Äôm going to fight to keep that little sign in my window.‚Äù

Helen Rigmaiden, you are our family forever. No amount of time or space could ever keep us from riding for you. ‚úäüèΩ

The Black Lives Matter sign she hung in her window two years ago is getting more attention than ever before. It's not the kind of attention she wanted.

9news.com

Woman fights to keep BLM sign in her window

item.title: ‚ÄúThis is not a new conversation we‚Äôre having. It‚Äôs one...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

‚ÄúThis is not a new conversation we‚Äôre having. It‚Äôs one that keeps coming up,‚Äù said Ari Lipscomb, an organizer with BLM Denver. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve consistently asked for accountability. We‚Äôve consistently asked for transparency. We‚Äôve consistently asked for shared power and for the actions of BLMGN to reflect the work that we do.‚Äù

The Black Lives Matter movement, founded in 2013, has changed the way the nation talks about race. But the organization itself may be disconnected from local chapters.

nbcnews.com

A movement, a slogan, a rallying cry: How Black Lives Matter changed America‚Äôs view on race

item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Good morning and happy Kwanzaa, beautiful people! The third principle of Kwanzaa is UJIMA, which means COLLECTIVE WORK AND RESPONSIBILITY. How do you work with your community and family to reach goals and get work done?

item.title: ‚ÄúWe need to acknowledge Karenga‚Äôs full story, but it...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

‚ÄúWe need to acknowledge Karenga‚Äôs full story, but it shouldn‚Äôt tarnish the value and beauty of the holiday that promotes collective action for the collective good.‚Äù

Thank you for sharing this op-ed, Amy!

I discovered Kwanzaa while attending Pomona College.

Op-Ed: The dark side of Kwanzaa's founder can't extinguish the holiday's beacon

item.title: Good morning, beautiful people, and happy Kwanzaa! Today is the...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Good morning, beautiful people, and happy Kwanzaa!
Today is the second day, so we are acknowledging the principle KUJICHAGULIA, which means SELF-DETERMINATION. Who are you? Who do you strive to be?
item.author: Black Lives Matter 5280

item.title: #TigrayGenocide Day 55 and the Ethiopian Government refuses to...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

#TigrayGenocide Day 55 and the Ethiopian Government refuses to stop the genocide on Tigray. Please help us sound the alarms.

1. There are more than 15 reported massacres. We need a neutral delegation to investigate and stop the killings.

2. More than 53,000 refugees are in Sudan who are reporting horrendous acts by invading forces. We need to hear their stories and act.

...

3. The evidence shows Eritrea has been involved from day one and is now looting, killing, burning crops and homes of Tigrayans. We need Eritrea to be forcibly removed from the state.

4. We need all services restored to Tigray, including all communications opened, electricity restored.

5. We need a humanitarian corridor opened immediately! The people of Tigray are starving. They have no food, fuel, medicine.

See More

MON, DEC 28

Stop The Genocide In Tigray

601 N Lincoln St, Denver, CO 80203, United States65 people interested
item.author: Black Lives Matter 5280

item.title: ‚ÄúOf the 21,863 students entering medical school in 2019, only...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

‚ÄúOf the 21,863 students entering medical school in 2019, only 1,626 were Black ‚Äî and only 619 were Black males,‚Äù Montgomery Rice said in a statement. ‚ÄúThis statistic is alarming for many reasons, not the least of which is the impact of patient care. Studies show that Black patients have better outcomes when treated by Black doctors.‚Äù

www.ajc.com/‚Ä¶/‚Ä¶/QYKYWAZYKRD6HLWOJGBLOGVVKM/%3foutputType=amp

Morehouse School of Medicine is teaming up with CommonSpirit Health in a 10-year, $100 million partnership to train more Black physicians and work toward health equity for underserved communities.

ajc.com

Morehouse School of Medicine enters $100M partnership to train more Black doctors

Morehouse School of Medicine is teaming up with CommonSpirit Health in a 10-year, $100 million partnership to train more Black physicians and work toward health equity for underserved communities.Morehouse School of Medicine is teaming up with CommonSpirit Health in a 10-year, $100 million partnership to train more Black physicians and work toward health equity for underserved communities.

item.title: Good morning, beautiful people! Today is the first day of...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Good morning, beautiful people!
Today is the first day of Kwanzaa. Kwanzaa is a holiday when Black folks celebrate their vast and rich heritage and culture by acknowledging the seven principles of Nguzo Saba. Although these principles are observed all year long in our communities and families, one principle is recognized each day from December 26th to January 1st by lighting a candle on the kinara (a special Kwanzaa candleholder).
The first principle of Kwanzaa is UMOJA, which means UNITY.

item.title: ‚Äú‚ÄúI swear to God I know I look like that crazy woman who is...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

‚Äú‚ÄúI swear to God I know I look like that crazy woman who is screaming about this terrible dream and everybody‚Äôs like ‚ÄòWhat is wrong with her?‚Äô I feel like I‚Äôm in a psych ward yelling, but nobody can hear me.‚Äù

Birhanemaskel‚Äôs head is 8,000 miles away at the refugee camp in Sudan where she was born after her parents fled bombing of their native Tigray in northern Ethiopia under a military dictatorship.‚Äù

Please help to amplify this story!!! #ApplyPressure! #WeStandWithTigray!

...

Millete, we stand with you.

item.title: ‚ÄúThe current conversation regarding re-opening school is all...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

‚ÄúThe current conversation regarding re-opening school is all about how closed schools are hurting the most vulnerable students‚ÄîBlack students, Latinx students, English Language Learners, poor students, and students with disabilities. But, in truth the parents clamoring the most about opening schools are the parents of the most privileged children.‚Äù

‚òïÔ∏è

It‚Äôs been a while since I‚Äôve written a blog. The Corona Virus has forced me to address so many things virtually, that the last thing I‚Äôve had the energy for was sitting down in front of the compute‚Ä¶

blackandsmart.wordpress.com

Stop Using Black Children as an Excuse to Open Your Schools

It‚Äôs been a while since I‚Äôve written a blog. The Corona Virus has forced me to address so many things virtually, that the last thing I‚Äôve had the energy for was sitting down in front of the compute‚Ä¶It‚Äôs been a while since I‚Äôve written a blog. item.title: This news is dope! One of our missions for the past few years...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

This news is dope! One of our missions for the past few years has been the #CounselorsNotCops initiative, so we are ecstatic to see it coming to fruition in Denver. Our children deserve better, & we‚Äôll never stop fighting until every last cop is removed from schools and replaced with adequate and effective counseling services. ‚úäüèΩ #NothingToLoseButOurChains

The move represents a 25% reduction in the number of school resource officers and is in line with a directive to eliminate all such officers by the end of the school year.

co.chalkbeat.org

Denver begins phasing police out of schools by eliminating 3 officer positions

The move represents a 25% reduction in the number of school resource officers and is in line with a directive to eliminate all such officers by the end of the school year.The move represents a 25% reduction in the number of school resource officers and is in line with a directive to eliminate all such officers by the end of the school year.
item.author: Black Lives Matter 5280

item.title: We have Denver & Aurora family trapped in a war zone. Be...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

We have Denver & Aurora family trapped in a war zone. Be relentless in asking your elected representatives what they are doing to bring them home! #NoWarInTigray #Tigray #TigrayGenocide

Millete Birhanemaskel is with Alula Solomon and 7 others.

Foreign citizens of Tigrayan background are being blocked from boarding planes and have no options to leave an active war zone. We heard a firsthand account of ...young women who were denied food, water and were stopped from boarding a plane meant for foreign citizens.

Bazen is a child who lives in Aurora. He has type 1 diabetes and there is NO medicine in Mekelle because of looting!

Share with your representatives. Be relentless. This is urgent!

#TigrayGenocide

See More

item.title: Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will continue to share links to bail/legal support fundraising in Denver, Minneapolis and beyond. We encourage friends to donate to BLM5280‚Äôs Emergency Fund using Venmo http://venmo.com/BLM5280 . These donations will be used for bail, legal support, and provision of direct services for Black people impacted by the current and ongoing crisis. If you would like to make a tax-deductible donation that we will have access to at a later date, you can visit our Colorado Gives Day Page to donate through our fiscal sponsor, Rocky Mountain Peace and Justice Center.

Working with residents and organizations in Denver, Black Lives Matter 5280 assists in building more loving and united Black communities while eliminating anti-Black violence and racism. To expose, address and eradicate structures and systems of oppression in Denver, BLM5280 uses a holistic racial j...
